events.comment: Set layers visibility and hide helper objects
Hide the buttons, they have an image only for better visualization during edition
Enable multitouch on mobiles
Don't read inputs if game is paused
Move to the left if left key is pressed or click on left button on mobile
Move to the right if right key is pressed or click on right button on mobile

Jump if up key is pressed or click on jump button on mobile
It works a single time per press (because the trigger once)
On floor animations, note that only one animation can be set at a time
On air animations, note that only once animation can be set a time
Teleport to the right if the player is totally out at left side
Teleport to the left if the player is totally out at right side

Move the player sprite and feet (helper objects) over the player object
It is done while the game is running only, this way on game over we can move the sprite as we want

Deactivate camera movement and rocks throwing the first time to run the tutorial
firstPlay is a global variable with a starting value of 1
Each time the player is over a new platform, deactivate the previous tips and show the next ones
In the second step (first platform) create a rock

In the last step flag the tutorial as complete setting the firstPlay global variable to 0, reset the scene since now won't launch the tutorial again
Also start moving the camera and throwing rocks

If player steps on a new platform, add score and flag the platform as "used" to not give scores anymore
Note that the score is not increased by 1 but by the amount of platforms, in this game it makes no difference, but this way if the player steps on two platforms at the same time the score will be increased by 2
Also update the text that shows the score

If the player is in a spring jump it won't step on platforms, instead increase the score by the platforms it leaves below
Again, the score is increased by the amount of platforms, in case it moves too fast and leaves more than one platform behind in a single frame

Only move the camera if it's enabled
Move the camera by the base speed + increased speed per platform times the number of platforms, everything limited by the maximum speed

Move the camera upward so the player is never off-focus
Only do it while the game is running, because in game over the player is deleted
The player is totally behind the camera, game over

The camera top border is over the last platform position, create a new platform above and update the top platform limit
Also set a random value between 1 and 100 to decide if a spring must be created
The random value is inside the spring random chance, create the spring in a valid position over the platform
Delete platforms totally outside the camera view (plus player height so the player can stand in the edge a bit more)
Only throw rocks if it's enabled
Create a rock above the camera limit (so the player can't see it being created) every rockTime seconds, and move it downwards
Rotate the rock to make it look a bit better
Delete rocks totally outside the camera view

If the player collides with a rock, game over
Don't kill the player if it's in a spring jump, that would be super unfair
Reset to common jump speed if the player is on floor
If the player is falling on a spring, increase the jump speed and launch it to the moon, also flag it as "in a spring jump"
Controls to pause only works while the game is running
Keyboard controls, switch the pause variable (0 to 1, or 1 to 0)
Unpause, common time scale and hidden pause layer
Pause, time scale to 0 (so every moving thing won't move anymore) and show the pause layer
Allow both desktop click and touch on the pause button
Game over events run only on game over/game not running

This event and its sub-events will run a single time on game over
Delete the player (but leave the sprite), show the game over layer and update the final score text
If the new score is higher than the best score, update the best score and show the new record text
Update the best score text
Move the player sprite downwards, for a small falling effect when hit by a rock
Reset button clicked or touched, reset the scene
